Class ec.e.hab.UnitPath 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.e.hab.UnitPath 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.hab.UnitPath
public class UnitPath
extends Object
A "pre-digested" pathname. Pathnames are represented externally by Java-style FQN strings (e.g., "foo.bar.baz") and internally by UnitPath objects.

UnitPath(String)
Construct a UnitPath by parsing an FQN string.
UnitPath(String[])
Construct a UnitPath from a pre-parsed FQN string.
UnitPath(UnitPath, String)
Construct a UnitPath by concatenating an FQN string to be parsed onto an earlier UnitPath.

childName()
Return the last element in the pathname of the path we are holding onto.
elements()
Enumerate the elements of the path.
parent()
Return a parent path for this path, or null if there is no parent.
toString()
Produce a nicely readable String representation of the path.

UnitPath 
  public UnitPath(String pathString)
Construct a UnitPath by parsing an FQN string.
Parameters:
pathString - The FQN string to be parsed.
UnitPath 
  public UnitPath(String path[])
Construct a UnitPath from a pre-parsed FQN string.
Parameters:
path - An array of path elements.
UnitPath 
  public UnitPath(UnitPath basePath,
                  String pathString)
Construct a UnitPath by concatenating an FQN string to be parsed onto an earlier UnitPath.
Parameters:
basePath - Another UnitPath to base upon
pathString - An FQN string to parse and concatenate.

parent 
  public UnitPath parent()
Return a parent path for this path, or null if there is no parent.
childName 
  public String childName()
Return the last element in the pathname of the path we are holding onto.
elements 
  public Enumeration elements()
Enumerate the elements of the path.
Returns:
An Enumeration over the path elements.
toString 
  public String toString()
Produce a nicely readable String representation of the path.
Returns:
An FQN String, suitable for printing.
Overrides:
toString in class Object
